meanings.definition: Slipperiness or smoothness in texture or appearance.
meanings.sent1: The ice skater moved with lubricity across the rink.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic applied oil to the gears to improve their lubricity.
meanings.sent3: The banana peel added an unexpected element of lubricity to the comedy routine.
meanings.sent4: Her words had a certain lubricity that made them slide effortlessly into the listener's mind.
meanings.sent5: The dancer's movements were filled with lubricity, captivating the audience.

meanings.definition: The quality of being sexually suggestive or arousing.
meanings.sent1: The movie had a subtle lubricity that left viewers intrigued.
meanings.sent2: The perfume's scent carried a hint of lubricity that caught his attention.
meanings.sent3: The playful wink added a touch of lubricity to the conversation.
meanings.sent4: The painting exuded a mysterious lubricity that drew people in.
meanings.sent5: Her outfit had a certain lubricity that turned heads wherever she went.

meanings.definition: The ability to reduce friction or resistance.
meanings.sent1: The lubricity of the new engine oil improved the car's performance.
meanings.sent2: The skier applied wax to his skis for better lubricity on the slopes.
meanings.sent3: The invention of the wheel greatly increased the lubricity of transportation.
meanings.sent4: The ball bearings were designed for maximum lubricity in the machinery.
meanings.sent5: The ice hockey player relied on the lubricity of his skates for swift movements on the ice.
